newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post business - Oct 30.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post business - Oct 30.

text.p: The Washington Post carried the following stories on the front page of its business section on Oct. 30:

WASHINGTON - The stock and bond markets rallied after the Labor Department reported that employers' labor costs rose slowly in the July-September period, a sign that inflation is likely to remain low.

WASHINGTON - America Online Inc. changed an accounting practice that watchdogs have been complaining about for months: the company was treating major expenses in such a way that allowed it to report it was making profits when it was actually paying out more money than it was taking in.
WASHINGTON - All 169 stores operated by Best Products Co. will be liquidated, the company announced.

WASHINGTON - The major U.S. stock markets have made unprecedented political contributions to help defeat a controversial ballot initiative in California that would make it easier for investors to sue companies for fraud.
